about_the_game:
The demo version of the narrative RPG Decadent allows you to fully experience the first act, living through the childhood years of a nobleman in the setting of the Russian Empire during the decadence era.

In this demo, you'll familiarize yourself with the surrounding world, your family, and the initial conflicts your character will face. The demo includes 15 scenes. Some of these are variable and may not be accessible in every playthrough, depending on your choices and gameplay style.

Grow, learn, and study what you believe will be useful in your life ahead. Develop your character, enhance desired traits, and prepare to alter the Empire's destiny!

All progress saved in the free version will be automatically transferred to the full version of Decadant.

Key Features:

• Branching storyline within the first act Experience the first ten years of your character's life, fully immersing yourself in their childhood.

• The role of the individual in history The game's plot is a complex tree of conditions, decisions, and their consequences. Your choices in various scenes will affect not only you but also those around you, your family, society, and the fate of the entire country.

name: Decadant (Декадант) Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Microsoft® Windows® 7
  • Processor: Pentium® 4 1.5 GHz / Athlon® XP
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DirectX® 9.0c compatible
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Storage: 300 MB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX® 9.0c compatible
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Microsoft® Windows® 10
  • Processor: Pentium® 4 1.5 GHz / Athlon® XP
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DirectX® 9.0c compatible
  • Storage: 300 MB available space

short_description: Rewrite history in this narrative RPG set in the twilight of Imperial Russia. Born into nobility, shape your destiny and the fate of a nation. Will you uphold the old order, lead the revolution, or forge your own path? Every choice has consequences. Your decisions will echo through time.
